content.body: annevk: Added a label to all remaining issues in https://github.com/w3c/preload/issues but it seems like I can't transfer this issue to a repo in another org
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: annevk: Added a label to all remaining issues in https://github.com/w3c/preload/issues but it seems like I can't transfer this issue to a repo in another org

content.body: Not sure if this is a permissions thing, and if e.g. I give you permissions on the preload repo, you'd be able to get them transferred
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Not sure if this is a permissions thing, and if e.g. I give you permissions on the preload repo, you'd be able to get them transferred

content.body: Yoav Weiss: oh sorry, I'm pretty sure you cannot transfer issues across organizations

content.body: annevk: Can you add a "preload" label on https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7887 https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7888 and https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7889?
content.formatted_body: annevk: Can you add a "preload" label on https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7887 https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7888 and https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7889?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: annevk: Can you add a "preload" label on https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7887 https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7888 and https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7889?
annevk: Can you add a "preload" label on https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7887 https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7888 and https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/7889?

content.body: I've added the label I suggested yesterday to a bunch of issues, including those (not entirely sure it's the best name as "resource hints" is not a term we use in HTML; so if anyone has something better let me know)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I've added the label I suggested yesterday to a bunch of issues, including those (not entirely sure it's the best name as "resource hints" is not a term we use in HTML; so if anyone has something better let me know)

content.body: I think "resource hints" is the best name, as it describes the adjacent spec (https://w3c.github.io/resource-hints/) which some of those still link to. The term Is used in HTML when linking to that spec
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think "resource hints" is the best name, as it describes the adjacent spec (https://w3c.github.io/resource-hints/) which some of those still link to. The term Is used in HTML when linking to that spec

content.body: Ah okay, I wasn't sure, though it seems that over time that specification might get fully integrated
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Ah okay, I wasn't sure, though it seems that over time that specification might get fully integrated

content.body:
> <@annevk:mozilla.org> Ah okay, I wasn't sure, though it seems that over time that specification might get fully integrated

I hope we will integrate the whole thing, in which case it's good that the label would be consistent with the then-historic title
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
Ah okay, I wasn't sure, though it seems that over time that specification might get fully integrated
I hope we will integrate the whole thing, in which case it's good that the label would be consistent with the then-historic title

content.body:
PSA for anybody interested in committer/issue/PR metrics for repos you manage or contribute to…
A few things I want to have stats/numbers for but which aren’t provided by any existing tools:

- At what rate is the project gaining new contributors?
- At what rate is the list of open issues increasing or decreasing?
- At what rate is the list of open PRs increasing or decreasing?
- How many commits are getting merged each month?
- How many contributors are actually active each month?

…so, I wrote a tool that generates data and graphs to answer those questions.
https://github.com/git-pulse/tools

content.body: annevk: Regarding https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/6364, we've got feedback from Google, Facebook and Zoom who all seem to agree that the COOP: Popups proposal would work for them. Do you have any other group you'd like to verify that solution works for? Given the complexity of the topic and the length of the discussion, I don't really know how to get smaller entities feedback.
content.formatted_body: annevk: Regarding https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/6364, we've got feedback from Google, Facebook and Zoom who all seem to agree that the COOP: Popups proposal would work for them. Do you have any other group you'd like to verify that solution works for? Given the complexity of the topic and the length of the discussion, I don't really know how to get smaller entities feedback.

Given the complexity of the topic and the length of the discussion, I don't really know how to get smaller entities feedback.

content.body: Arthur Hemery: I guess auth0 might be good to ask? Perhaps a way to get some attention from the login community would be a short email to https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-fed-id/?
